title: Language Configuration for Semantic Analysis
description: Configuration for programming languages to support semantic analysis using tree-sitter queries.

^[a-z_]+$.description: Configuration for a specific language, identified by its name (e.g., 'python').

shared_token_queries.description: Defines classes to join tokens semantically. For example, if a variable definition is changed in one diff, other diffs that use that variable can be grouped together. Each property within this object represents a distinct semantic class of tokens.

general_queries.description: Tree-sitter queries to find all occurrences of tokens belonging to this class. These queries should match singular nodes.

items.description: A tree-sitter query with a '@placeholder' capture.

definition_queries.description: Tree-sitter queries to find only the definition sites of tokens in this class.

items.description: A tree-sitter query with a '@placeholder' capture.

scope_queries.description: Tree-sitter queries that match entire scope blocks (e.g., functions, classes, if-statements). This is used to determine which lines of code belong to which scope.

items.description: A tree-sitter query with a '@placeholder' capture.

comment_queries.description: Tree-sitter queries used to identify comment-only lines for special processing.

items.description: A tree-sitter query with a '@placeholder' capture.

share_tokens_between_files.description: Indicates whether tokens can be semantically shared between different files. This is rarely false.
